title: Open Network Login Page
content:
Hello -

Tech Support Guy System Info Utility version 1.0.0.9 OS Version: Microsoft Windows 10 Home, 64 bit, Build 19045, Installed 20220711223524.000000-420 Processor: AMD A4-5300 APU with Radeon(tm) HD Graphics, AMD64 Family 21 Model 16 Stepping 1, CPU Count: 2 Total Physical RAM: 8 GB Graphics Card: Microsoft Basic Display Adapter Hard Drives: C: 930 GB (817 GB Free); D: 931 GB (756 GB Free); S: 1862 GB (1096 GB Free); Motherboard: ASUSTeK COMPUTER INC. A55BM-PLUS, ver Rev X.0x, s/n 140525905700081 System: American Megatrends Inc., ver ALASKA - 1072009, s/n System Serial Number Antivirus: Windows Defender, Enabled and Updated

Firefox 129.0.2 (640-bit) Windows 10 Professional (x64) Version 22H2 (build 19045.4842)

SEE ATTACHMENT: So from where did the red-highlighted business appear from?

Clicking on OPEN NETWORK LOGIN PAGE results in the lower part -- PLEASE VERIFY YOU ARE A HUMAN - PRESS AND HOLD showing up. Pressing-and-holding only results in that PRESS AND HOLD business reappearing; no way to get past it. RESULT being that I am unable to access bookmarked websites as I always have previously.

If I click on the X to the far right of that line, the OPEN NETWORK LOGIN PAGE disappears and the lower PRESS AND HOLD does not show up. HOWEVER! Here is what does show up instead of a website being opened:

Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site. We can’t connect to the server at signin.centurylink.com. If you entered the right address, you can: 

   Try again later    Check your network connection    Check that Firefox has permission to access the web (you might be connected but behind a firewall)

- Trying again later only results in a repeat. - Network connection is quite well connected. - Firefox has ALWAYS had permission to access the web.

MAKES NO SENSE! Any informative assistance? Thank you.
creator: Hikermann

title: Como fazer com que todos os meus dispositivos fiquem sincronizados?
content: Faz aproximadamente seis meses que eu tenho tentado fazer com que todos os meus dispositivos fiquem sincronizados. Entretanto, o Firefox não sincroniza. Eu não consigo acessar o meu histórico, as minhas senhas, nada pelo meu Android. Tudo que eu tenho está no Windows de forma local e o Firefox se recusa a sincronizar com outros dispositivos. Ainda que eu tenha configurado o Firefox para sincronizar todas as minhas configurações, nada acontece.
creator: user66019784249022661161564249995592055966

title: "next slide" and "previous slide" buttons do not appear on websites (e.g. MSN)
content: When I am browsing in either regular mode or safe mode, the scroll buttons for next or previous slide do not appear on the MSN web page. However, if I open a private browsing tab from either regular or safe mode, the scroll buttons appear and are functional. I am running Firefox version 129.0.2 (64 bit) on Windows 11 Home version 23H2. I have refreshed Firefox and also uninstalled and reinstalled Firefox. I have also toggled "always show scrollbars" on in Windows settings. No change. These scroll buttons function in other browsers (Edge, Chrome), but I prefer Firefox. Where do I go from here?
creator: st.troutmask.browser

title: Google sign in pop ups
content: When I try to search using safari or Firefox, a pop up requires me to sign in to google. How can I stop this or work around it? Is there some way to change the search engine?

title: no sound
content: Hey, my Firefox suddenly isn't making any sound anymore, but everything else on my PC is working fine. The troubleshooting page didn't help at all either. I'm getting desperate—restart, reinstalling, etc. didn't help either.
creator: peter.lierschx2

title: PDF Viewer
content: While reading a PDF using Firefox PDF Viewer, I highlighted certain passages occasionally saving (using the print icon) for future retrieval. Later when I did re-open the file, none of my highlighting was visible. I have tried alternative browsers, various PDF readers, etc. without luck. I really do need that highlighting. Thank you
creator: jgashmore
